body:
The main difference I see is that in the first script, the initialization occurs inside $(function() {}) while in the second one it is outside of it and it is not even called. So this change should help you:

$(function(){
    MyDataTable();
});
function MyDataTable(){

  $('#TableID').DataTable({

          //Blah Blah Blah
       });
}

Basically, the function is called after the document was loaded.
title: DataTable is not a function
